info.title: Contentstack Content Delivery API OpenAPI Specification
info.description:
The Content Delivery API (CDA), available at cdn.contentstack.com, is a read-only API used to retrieve content from your Contentstack account and deliver it to your web or mobile properties. Contentstack provides an OpenAPI JSON file that consists of a set of preconfigured REST API requests that will make it easy for you to get started with the Contentstack Delivery APIs and try out our API requests through the Swagger Editor.

Here are the details of the important information key used in this file:

Key Value
Base URL
  • North America: https://cdn.contentstack.io/
  • Europe: https://eu-cdn.contentstack.com/
api_key
  • North America: blt02f7b45378b008ee
  • Europe: bltd88b56bcda5594d5
access_token
  • North America: cs5b69faf35efdebd91d08bcf4
  • Europe: cs408c732861b2aa495971ae51
environment
  • North America: production
  • Europe: production

CDA OpenAPI Details:

  • Version: 1.0.0
  • Last Updated: March 21, 2022

get.description:
The Get all content types call returns comprehensive information of all the content types available in a particular stack in your account.

To use the API Request, you'll need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the All Content Types API Reference document

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include in response the total count of content types available in your stack.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to true to include the _branch top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

get.description:
This call returns information of a specific content type. It returns the content type schema, but does not include its entries.

To use the API Request, you'll need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Single Content Type API Reference document

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to true to include the _branch top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

get.description:
This call returns comprehensive information of all the global fields available in a particular stack in your account.

To use the API Request, you'll need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the All Global Fields API Reference document

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to true to include the _branch top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

get.description:
This request allows you to fetch comprehensive details of a specific global field.

To use the API Request, you'll need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Single Global Field API Reference document

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to true to include the _branch top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

get.summary: Get all entries | Equals Operator | Equals Operator Within Group | Equals Operator Within Modular Blocks | Not-equals Operator.....

  • Equals Operator Within Modular Blocks

  • Reference Search Not-equals

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.

parameters.name: include_fallback
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the published localized content from the fallback locale when the specified locale does not contain published content.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to true to include the _branch top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Enter the maximum number of entries to be returned.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enter the number of entries to be skipped.

parameters.name: asc
parameters.description: Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

parameters.name: desc
parameters.description: Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

parameters.name: only[BASE][]
parameters.description: Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

parameters.name: except[BASE][]
parameters.description: Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to get the total count of the entries.

get.description:
The Get a single entry request fetches a particular entry of a content type.

To use the API Request, you'll need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Single Entry API Reference document

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Enter the latest published version number. Passing a draft version number will return a blank response.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language of which you want to include the entries. Only the published localized entries will be displayed.

parameters.name: include_fallback
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the published localized content from the fallback locale when the specified locale does not contain published content.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to true to include the _branch top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

get.description:
The Get all assets request fetches the list of all the assets of a particular stack. It returns the content of each asset in JSON format. You can also specify the environment of which you want to get the assets.

To use the API Request, you'll need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the All Assets API Reference document

parameters.name: include_fallback
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the published asset details from the fallback locale when the specified locale does not contain published content.

parameters.name: relative_urls
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the relative URLs of the assets in the response.

parameters.name: include_dimension
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the dimensions (height and width) of the image in the response. Supported image types: JPG, GIF, PNG, WebP, BMP, TIFF, SVG, and PSD.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to true to include the _branch top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

get.description:
The Get a single asset request fetches the latest version of a specific asset of a particular stack.

To use the API Request, you'll need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Single Asset API Reference document

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Specify the version number of the asset that you want to retrieve. To retrieve a specific version, keep the environment parameter blank. If the version is not specified, the details of the latest version will be retrieved.

parameters.name: include_fallback
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include published asset details from the fallback locale when the specified locale does not contain published information.

parameters.name: include_dimension
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the dimensions (height and width) of the image in the response. Supported image types: JPG, GIF, PNG, WebP, BMP, TIFF, SVG, and PSD.

parameters.name: relative_urls
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the relative URL of the asset in the response.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to true to include the _branch top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

get.summary: Initial Sync | Sync using pagination token | Subsequent Sync
get.description:
For more information on the individual requests, click on their respective documentation links below: And below this line, we'll be providing the documentation links in bulleted list form.

  • Initial Sync
  • Sync using pagination token
  • Subsequent Sync

parameters.name: init
parameters.description: Enter ‘true’ to perform a complete sync of all your app data.

parameters.name: content_type_uid
parameters.description: Enter the content type UID, if you want to sync entries of specific content types.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the locale to retrieve and sync the content published on a specific locale.

parameters.name: start_from
parameters.description: Specify the start date, if you want to retrieve and sync data starting from a specific date.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Enter the type(s) of content you want to retrieve and sync. You can pass multiple types as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Enter the pagination token that you received in the response body of the previous sync process.

parameters.name: sync_token
parameters.description: Enter the sync token that you received in the response body of the previous completed Synchronization process to get the delta updates
